result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a School], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 5 years bifurcated sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.

Provide DNA sample if not previously provided.  Pay DNA surcharge, costs of supervision and court obligations.  Cooperate with counseling, treatment and programs determined appropriate.  Follow through with recommendations.  Do not associate with those who have been convicted of drug offenses unless in a therapeutic setting.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.  Firearm prohibition warning given.

supervisions.notes:
**CORRECTED 8-2-2016: To reflect 3 years of initial confinement and 2 years of extended supervision.**

Defendant Michael A Miller in court with attorney Pamela Popken.  Defendant Michael A Miller in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The State is in compliance with Ch. 950. Parties have reviewed PSI. No additions or corrections noted by the State. Defense puts corrections on the record.

BTC: 15CF1086, Ct 1 - Total sentence is 5 yrs WPS bifurcated as 2 yrs IC, 3 yrs ES/CFTS
                            Ct 3 - Total sentence is 5 yrs WPS bifurcated as 3 yrs IC, 2 yrs ES, consec to Ct 1

                             Ct 2 - Total sentence is 2 yrs WPS bifurcated as 1 yr IC, 1 yr ES, conc with Ct 1 but consec to 15CF1086
                             Ct 3 - 9 mos RCJ, conc with Cts 1 & 2 but consec to 15CF1086

Preliminary hearing on July 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Michael A Miller in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Michael A Miller in custody.  Matthew J. Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
